intro: Ceradenia kalawayae, commonly known as the Kalaway nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or disturbed soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
